results.title: 'Remembrance of things past'...a watercolour memoir for Richard
results.brief_description: When Judith recalls Richard’s legacy, she sees it through his watercolour paintings that stand as a aesthetic record to his life, from his childhood to his adult academic pursuits.
results.title_for_label: ‘Remembrance of things past’…a watercolour memoir for Richard

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public express(February 2007)
results.brief_description: These eleven short stories were created as part of a Digital Storytelling workshop in February 2007. They mostly run for less than two minutes and cover diverse subject matter, including treasured family members, life changing events and vocational experiences.

results.title: Proceed to the blue desk please
results.creator_credit: Simone West, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone West juxtaposes the urgency of processing child patients that are suffering from burns with the sense of urgency that assail the loved ones that want everything to be ok.

results.title: My university challenge
results.creator_credit: Ray Martin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ray Martin and his girlfriend enrolled in a university course in Thailand to become qualified English teachers. It was here that Martin set himself a challenge that not many people had been successful at achieving.

results.title: How should we remember Stuart?
results.creator_credit: Kath Ensor, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her grandmother, Elizabeth, Kath Ensor remembers her grandfather, Stuart. Encompassing his time serving in the RAAF during World War II, his love for his family and his positive attitude, despite experiencing ill health.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kath Ensor, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Speaking for her grandmother, Elizabeth, Kath Ensor remembers her grandfather, Stuart. Encompassing his time serving in the RAAF during World War II, his love for his family and his positive attitude, despite experiencing ill health.
